title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message:
Hi on this board I have quarter fan spin, checked already
R7021/22 - right values at 10 ohm
R7051 - 2.5 ohms
r7052 - 0.2 ohms

PPBUS_G3H is 12.63v but goes low to 12.0v and when it goes up again, the fan tries to start... any ideas?

title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message:
[QUOTE="2click, post: 67060, member: 24760"]
R7021/22 - right values at 10 ohm
[/QUOTE]
You mean it’s 10ohm each or between them? Resistance between pins 27/28 of U7000 should be 20ohm. Are big coils on the board pulsing while quarter fan spin?

title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message: Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message: I tried SMC bypass, no luck, still getting quarter spin, no orange light when the battery is connected... I reballed the SMC, nothing... doing the same... what else to check? Thank you!

title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message:
Did you try original 60/85W charger?
What about lab PSU?

You didn't reply to the questions from a previous post...

title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message:
Using original 85 watt magsafe charger...
Its 10 ohms each, between them it is 20.7 ohms

title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message: Remove F7040 and check if voltage at C7040 is steady 12.5V.

title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message: Removed F7040 and PPBUS_G3H was 12.34v and going slowly up. It took around 5 minutes to get to 12.56v the strange this is that it is still going up slowly... it got to 12.61v and going slowly up... I disconnected the magsafe...

title: 820-3115-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
message:
So you have a problem on the charger side.
Keep F7040 out, untill get stable voltage at C7040.

Post exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
